alert.note: Alert for Baraga; Houghton (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 15 at 7:35PM EDT until further notice by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Sturgeon River near Chassell affecting Houghton and Baraga Counties. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt snowpack and increase river flows. In addition, recent rainfall could increase river levels. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is currently forecast. * WHERE...Sturgeon River near Chassell. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Lower portions of Sturgeon River Road... Aho Road...and Rajala Road are impassable At 14.5 feet, Water reaches the bottom of the bridge between Sturgeon River Road and Rajala Road. The bridge begins to cause backwater effects at this stage * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EDT Wednesday, April 12 the stage was 10.1 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by Sunday afternoon at 400 PM EDT.
